result.execSummary:
The defendant Leroy A. Martin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Any probation now serving.

miscConds.notes:
If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Must maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Must maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions. 

If the defendant is accepted into the Jackson County Drug Court Program, the state and defense will recommend 2 years probation with the same conditions, plus an additional condition that the defendant successfully complete that program.

110 Days credit if revoked.

Defendant advised on the DNA submission requirement.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located. 

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion. 

Defendant shall have no contact with known drug users, does not include former users now in recovery.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Must pay all costs of supervision and court ordered financial obligations during the term of probation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Leroy A. Martin

defendant.name: Martin, Leroy A.
defendant.address: 903 Pierce St, Black River Falls, WI 54615

records.addlTxt: Return to sender. Moved left no address. Unable to forward.  JOC's

Court questioned defendant on his understanding of the waiver of preliminary hearing.  He stated he understood.  Court found that the defendant knowingly and intelligently waived his right to have a preliminary hearing.

11:34 AM Defendant Leroy A. Martin appeared by video, in custody of JCJ.  Attorney April Lande appeared by video for Leroy A. Martin.  Attorney Jeri Marsolek appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant agrees to continue remotely. State is in compliance with victim rights. Pleads no contest to count 1 in 20CF177,  22CF1 no contest to count 1 and 2.  Charges in 22CF124 to be DRI. Count 2 in 20CF177 is DRI.

Court reviewed the elements and potential penalties of the charge the defendant plead to.  He understood.   Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant. Felony warnings given.  He understood. Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of count 1 Possession of Methamphetamine contrary to 961.41(3g)(g) in case 20CF177, in case 22CF1 Found guilty of count 1 Possession of Methamphetamine contrary to 961.41(3g)(g)  and guilty to count 2 Bail Jumping-Felony (1) contrary to946.49(1)(b).  Charges in 22CF124 DRI. Count 2 in 20CF177 DRI.
Defendant  exercised his right to allocution.

Joint recommendation that the court withhold sentence and place defendant on probation for 3 years with the following conditions:  Maintain absolute sobriety, AODA, NOALC provision, no drug provision, no contact with known users (does not include former users in recovery), 110 days credit if revoked.
Defense stipulates to the 110 days credit.

Court adopts joint recommendation orders sentence withheld probation for 3 years with the following conditions: Maintain absolute sobriety, AODA, Not to posses or consume alcohol or be where alcohol is present. Not to consume or posses control substances without a valid prescription or be present at any location where controlled substances are illegally used or distributed.  Subject to random testing. No contact with known drug users (does not include former users that are in recovery). Any other conditions deemed appropriate by agent. Costs.  If the defendant is accepted into the Jackson County Drug Court Program, the state and defense will recommend 2 years probation with the same conditions, plus an additional condition that the defendant successfully complete that program.  110 days credit if revoked.

Case Numbers 20CF177, 22CF01 and 22CF124 are all set for Plea on October 13, 2022.  22CF124 to be handled by Judge Goodman as part of a global resolution of all 3 cases. ADA Marsolek confirmed global resolution of cases and approved by JW 10/12/2022.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 13, 2022 at 11:30 am.
in custody Jackson County Jail

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.
Defendant must reside with parents CH and DL  at 903 Pierce St, Black River Falls, WI.

Cash bond covers 20CF177, 22CF1, 22CF124
1:07 PM Defendant Leroy A. Martin appeared by video, in custody from JCJ.  Attorney Jeri Marsolek in court for State of Wisconsin. State requested cash bond forfeited.

Bail/Bond Hearing at 1:00 p.m.
